Function Documentation

int main ( int  argc,
char *  argv[] 
)

The main program.

Starts the initialization methods and contains the main computation loop

Parameters:
argc The number of command line arguments, should be two: program name (by default) and project name
argv The command line arguments array: by default program name at first position (index 0), and then the project( which is specified when calling the program name (e.g. s./sph ../cases/couette) at index 1


below the rough structure of the main function:

inizialize google logger

initializations

if second input parameter exists, write it in auxiliary varaible

  • global initialization (by defining an object of class Initiation (initialization "automatically" done at this moment (from .tcl or .rst file) by constructor method of Initiation class. That is by the way the reason why the initiation::initiation method does not figure in the call graph of the main function (constructors are not shwon there)

choose a kernel

< - initiate the particle manager

< - create materials, forces and real particles

Todo:
{this is only a temporary solution, when code works, the variable can either be moved into external initiation file, or the purely 1D case can be removed completely (but not as long as the 2D particle distribution does not work!!!)}

< - initiate boundary conditions and boundary particles

a smart pointer to timesolver

call a HydroTimeSolver constructor and get a shared_ptr

call a GasTimeSolverLeapFrog constructor and get a shared_ptr

call a GasTimeSolverPredCorr constructor and get a shared_ptr

make sure the pointer is created

  • initialize output class (should be the last to be initialized)

Todo:
{define a variable which controls the use of boundary conditions and solve it smarter than just testing if (ini.kernel_type != "CubicSpline1D") }


computation loop starts

  • call the time slover (who iterates over one output time interval)

  • output results after a time interval
